intro: Lucilia lopezmirandae, commonly known as the Lopez-Miranda fly. This species belongs to the family Calliphoridae, which includes blowflies and flesh flies. It is characterized by its metallic green or blue body coloration, which is typical of many blowfly species. The larvae of Lucilia lopezmirandae are often found on decaying organic matter, playing a role in decomposition. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is primarily found in certain regions of South America.
